data.title: alert role
data.description: A type of live region with important, and usually time-sensitive, information. See related alertdialog and status.

data.title: alertdialog role
data.description: A type of dialog that contains an alert message, where initial focus goes to an element within the dialog. See related alert and dialog.

data.title: aria-activedescendant attribute
data.description: Identifies the currently active element when DOM focus is on a composite widget, textbox, group, or application.

data.title: aria-atomic attribute
data.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region based on the change notifications defined by the aria-relevant attribute.

data.title: aria-autocomplete attribute
data.description: Indicates whether inputting text could trigger display of one or more predictions of the user's intended value for an input and specifies how predictions would be presented if they are made.

data.title: aria-busy attribute
data.description: Indicates an element is being modified and that assistive technologies MAY want to wait until the modifications are complete before exposing them to the user.

data.title: aria-checked attribute
data.description: Indicates the current "checked" state of checkboxes, radio buttons, and other widgets. See related aria-pressed and aria-selected.

data.title: aria-controls attribute
data.description: Identifies the element (or elements) whose contents or presence are controlled by the current element. See related aria-owns.

data.title: aria-current attribute
data.description: Indicates the element that represents the current item within a container or set of related elements.

data.title: aria-describedby attribute
data.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object. See related aria-labelledby.

data.title: aria-details attribute
data.description: Identifies the element that provides a detailed, extended description for the object. See related aria-describedby.
data.notes: There is poor support for `aria-details`, so it should not be used as the only means of conveying the relationship between an object and its detailed description. Since `aria-details` can only reference an element that is elsewhere on the same page, the details will likely sill be discoverable by screen reader users. Until support is more robust, it might be worth while to consider an additional indication that the object has a detailed description on the same page by way of the `alt` attribute or similar method.

data.title: aria-disabled attribute
data.description: Indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled, so it is not editable or otherwise operable. See related aria-hidden and aria-readonly.

data.title: aria-errormessage attribute
data.description: Identifies the element that provides an error message for the object.  See related aria-invalid and aria-describedby.

data.title: aria-expanded attribute
data.description: Indicates whether the element, or another grouping element it controls, is currently expanded or collapsed.

data.title: aria-flowto attribute
data.description: Identifies the next element (or elements) in an alternate reading order of content which, at the user's discretion, allows assistive technology to override the general default of reading in document source order.

data.title: aria-haspopup attribute
data.description:
This attribute indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog.

 Aria 1.0 values are well supported, such as `true`, `false`, and `menu` (which is the same as `true`). New values such as `dialog`, `grid`, `listbox`, and `tree` are not supported. This lack of support might cause significant issues for screen reader users. For example, `aria-haspopup="listbox"` being announced as `aria-haspopup="menu"` could lead users to think that something the behaves like a native `<select>` (`listbox`) is a `menu`.

data.title: aria-invalid attribute
data.description: Indicates the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application. See related aria-errormessage.

data.title: aria-label attribute
data.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element. See related aria-labelledby.

data.title: aria-labelledby attribute
data.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element. See related aria-describedby.

data.title: aria-level attribute
data.description: Defines the hierarchical level of an element within a structure.

data.title: aria-live attribute
data.description: Indicates that an element will be updated, and describes the types of updates the user agents, assistive technologies, and user can expect from the live region.

data.title: aria-modal attribute
data.description: Indicates whether an element is modal when displayed. For more robust support, consider making the rest of the document [inert](https://github.com/WICG/inert) when an element has aria-modal=true.

data.title: aria-owns attribute
data.description: Identifies an element (or elements) in order to define a visual, functional, or contextual parent/child relationship between DOM elements where the DOM hierarchy cannot be used to represent the relationship. See related aria-controls.

data.title: aria-pressed attribute
data.description: Indicates the current "pressed" state of toggle buttons. See related aria-checked and aria-selected.

data.title: aria-relevant attribute
data.description: Indicates what notifications the user agent will trigger when the accessibility tree within a live region is modified. See related aria-relevant.

data.title: aria-required attribute
data.description: Indicates that user input is required on the element before a form may be submitted.

data.title: aria-roledescription attribute
data.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the role of an element.

data.title: aria-selected attribute
data.description: Indicates the current "selected" state of various widgets. See related aria-checked and aria-pressed.

data.title: aria-sort attribute
data.description: Indicates if items in a table or grid are sorted in ascending or descending order.

data.title: button role
data.description: An input that allows for user-triggered actions when clicked or pressed. See related link.

data.title: checkbox role
data.description: A checkable input that has three possible values: true, false, or mixed.

data.title: columnheader role
data.description: A cell containing header information for a column.

data.title: combobox role
data.description: A composite widget containing a single-line textbox and another element, such as a listbox or grid, that can dynamically pop up to help the user set the value of the textbox.

data.title: dialog role
data.description: A dialog is a descendant window of the primary window of a web application. For HTML pages, the primary application window is the entire web document, i.e., the body element.

data.title: grid role
data.description: A composite widget containing a collection of one or more rows with one or more cells where some or all cells in the grid are focusable by using methods of two-dimensional navigation, such as directional arrow keys.

data.title: gridcell role
data.description: A cell in a grid or treegrid.

data.title: group role
data.description: A set of user interface objects which are not intended to be included in a page summary or table of contents by assistive technologies.

data.title: heading role
data.description: A heading for a section of the page.

data.title: link role
data.description: An interactive reference to an internal or external resource that, when activated, causes the user agent to navigate to that resource. See related button.

data.title: listbox role
data.description: A widget that allows the user to select one or more items from a list of choices. See related combobox and list.

data.title: log role
data.description: A type of live region where new information is added in meaningful order and old information may disappear

data.title: menu role
data.description: A type of widget that offers a list of choices to the user.

data.title: menuitem role
data.description: An option in a set of choices contained by a menu or menubar.

data.title: option role
data.description: A selectable item in a select list.

data.title: radiogroup role
data.description: A group of radio buttons.

data.title: status role
data.description: A type of live region whose content is advisory information for the user but is not important enough to justify an alert, often but not necessarily presented as a status bar.

data.title: CSS generated content
data.description: CSS Generated Content is content that is added to the DOM via CSS such as ::before and ::after content.
data.notes: Avoid using CSS generated content for meaningful textual additions.

data.title: CSS generated content - alternative text
data.description: The content property accepts alternative text to be specified after a slash (/) after the last <content-list>.

data.title: hyperlink element
data.description: If the a element has an href attribute, then it represents a hyperlink (a hypertext anchor) labeled by its contents.

data.title: placeholder link element
data.description: If the a element has no href attribute, then the element represents a placeholder for where a link might otherwise have been placed, if it had been relevant, consisting of just the element's contents.

data.title: button element
data.description: The button element represents a button labeled by its contents.

data.title: datalist element
data.description: The datalist element represents a set of option elements that represent predefined options for other controls. It is attached to an input via the list attribute.

data.title: dd element
data.description: Description list - description element. See [the `dl` element](/tech/html/dl_element) for more information.

data.title: details element
data.description: The details element represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls.

data.title: disabled attribute
data.description: The HTML `disabled` attribute lets authors disable form controls. Note, adding the disabled attribute to form controls will generally cause them to not be focusable.

data.title: dl element (description list)
data.description: Description list element. See the related [`dt` element](/tech/html/dt_element) and the [`dd` element](/tech/html/dd_element) for more information.
data.notes: The `dl` element and its associated `dt` and `dd` elements have poor to non-existent support. If it is critically important to convey relationships between terms and descriptions and the values of the two can be confused with each other (think a matching list of colors such as "red: blue", consider another approach such as a table or headings. It is often possible for a user to determine which text is a key and which text is a value just based upon the text alone. If this is the case for your implementation, it might be fine to use a `dl` element and hope for better support in the future.

data.title: dt element
data.description: Description list - term element. See [the `dl` element](/tech/html/dl_element) for more information.

data.title: fieldset element
data.description: The fieldset element represents a set of form controls (or other content) grouped together, optionally with a caption.

data.title: h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, and h6 elements
keywords: h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, and h6 elements

data.title: headers attribute
data.description: The `headers` attribute gives authors a way to override implicit cell headers (via `<th>` elements) to accurately describe the structure of complex tables to assistive technology. Note: this is a difficult feature to test, as implicit headers often interfere with results. It's not possible to tell where the header originitated from when testing with an assistive technology; is this header sourced implicitly (via `<th>` elements) or explicitly (via the `headers` attribute). Most real world tables that require the `headers` attribute also make use of implicit headers. Several tests are included for this feature because of this, and some of the results may be false negatives.

data.title: input[type="button"] element
data.description: The input element represents a button with no default behavior.

data.title: input[type="checkbox"] element
data.description: The input element represents a two-state control that represents the element's checkedness state.

data.title: input[type="color"] element
data.description: The input element represents a color well control, for setting the element's value to a string representing a simple color.

data.title: input[type="image"] element
data.description: The input element represents either an image from which a user can select a coordinate and submit the form, or alternatively a button from which the user can submit the form.

data.title: input[type="radio"] element
data.description: The html radio input

data.title: input[type="reset"] element
data.description: The input element represents a button that, when activated, resets the form.

data.title: label element
data.description: The HTML `<label>` element provides instructions for an associated form control.
data.notes: Use the explicit label technique wherever possible and avoid depending on implicit labels.

data.title: lang attribute
data.description: The HTML `lang` attributes lets authors change the language for content on a page.

data.title: legend element
data.description: The legend element represents a caption for the rest of the contents of the legend element's parent fieldset element, if any.

data.title: list attribute
data.description: The list attribute is used to identify an element that lists predefined options suggested to the user.

data.title: max attribute
data.description: The min and max attributes indicate the allowed range of values for the element.

data.title: maxlength attribute
data.description: The min and max attributes indicate the allowed range of values for the element.

data.title: min attribute
data.description: The min and max attributes indicate the allowed range of values for the element.

data.title: optgroup element
data.description: The optgroup element represents a group of option elements with a common label.

data.title: required attribute
data.description: The required attribute is a boolean attribute. When specified, the element is required.

data.title: role attribute
data.description: The role attribute is used to convey the purpose of various elements to users of assistive technology. While the role attribute is defined in ARIA, these expectations test the attribute as implemented in HTML.

data.title: scope attribute
data.description: The HTML `scope` attributes lets authors define the scope of a table header (row or column).

data.title: section element
data.description: Per the HTML AAM spec, a section element will be mapped to the region role if the section element has an accessible name. Otherwise, no corresponding role. Only the `aria-label`, `aria-labelledby`, and `title` attributes can provide an accessible name.

data.title: summary element
data.description: The details element represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls. Note that per the HTML5 spec, headings are allowed in the summary element.

data.title: title element
data.description: The title of an SVG
